Warren, just answer fucking yes or no. Be up front about raising the taxes of the middle classes. Long winded answer = yes. Take a bath.  
  
When she says costs will go down, she’s clearly just being careful with words. Sure,  health care costs may go down but taxes will go up to attempt to offset that.  
  
Also, her study she keeps citing is flawed. They went to bankruptcy court and asked people who were declaring bankruptcy if medical bills played a role. That’s different than asking if overwhelming medical bills *led them to the court*.
Haven’t they asked Warren this about 1,000 times?
It's that unpopular

She dances around the answer because she doesn’t want to give them the soundbite. Yeah, my taxes are going to go up but my premiums will disappear. I’ll save $6000 a year in premiums, my employer will save almost 10k, but my taxes will go up a few thousand. I’m still saving money. 

And I’m still voting for her.
70,000 of them!

God I’m so sick of this debate structure. Every question met with no answer and with some weak ass sound byte. Sanders lays out the "corruption" word. Good. Need to establish new laws defining right vs wrong. Thank you, Sanders.

If it's wrong when Trump's children milk his Presidency for ill gotten gains, then it's obviously wrong for everyone else. Duh. I will never defend that. And this corruption is exactly what the American people are sick and tired of. It may be normal for folks inside the establishment bubble, but times have changed and folks have caught on. We're not going to put up with it anymore. And it would be a disaster to run a corrupt individual against a corrupt individual. So please, I beg the Democratic Party, do not do this to us. Have we learned absolutely nothing from 2016? Next.

The problem is that if you say "Yes, taxes will go up, but you won't have to pay a health care premium anymore and in the end you'll save money overall" gets edited to "Yes, taxes will go up" and your opponents just yell that part all day, every day and that's all that the people that aren't paying attention will hear.

It is obviously taxes. Less taxes than people pay in healthcare, but it is a conservative bait question to get the soundbite of "Yes I will raise taxes" despite it being less overall cost.
